results.title: The Bad society
results.brief_description: In December 1976, 16,000 people converged at the Cotter River in Canberra for the “Down to earth” festival; a conference on alternative lifestyles. In attendance were Reverend George Davies, Dr. Jim Cairns, Dr. Jim Falk as well as thousands of counter culture followers. This documentary explores the festival and the themes of politics and social change. The Philisophy of Ex Deputy Prime Minister, Dr. Jim Cairns is particularly focussed on with its emphasis on how a nation state creates a ‘bad society’ and how communal life and a counter culture lifestyle forms the only radicalism against society.

results.title: From little things big things grow: Kev Carmody, singer
results.creator_credit: Trevor Graham, Ned Lander, Rachel Perkins and City Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Blood brothers (A)”.
Interspersed with video clips from his protest album “Pillars of society” Kev Carmody talks about his life and music. Born in Goronba, Queensland, on a cattle station, the son of an Irish stockman and his Aboriginal wife, Carmody spent his early years living off the land, but absorbing western culture through the ABC and old records. Taken away from his parents at the age of ten, he was put in a Christian school and sent home twice a year. After several years working at various menial jobs, whilst developing his music he eventually gained a Ph.D in Australian history, using oral material and methods rather than a written thesis. A fascinating portrait of a committed man.
results.title_for_label: From little things big things grow: Kev Carmody, singer

results.title: Australia, Where Time Began
results.brief_description: Ravaged by time, wind, water and a scorching sun, the world’s most extraordinary landscape has evolved - a landscape of contrast, mystery and awe. This film is an explanation of how the deserts, salt lakes, monoliths, escarpments and gorges of the planet’s only island continent were created. It also portrays the endearing animals and plants which have adapted to an often hostile environment.

results.title: Three in one
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes and Australian Tradition Films
results.brief_description: A trilogy of Australian stories about mateship. “Joe Wilson’s Mates”, from a story by Henry Lawson, is set in the 1890’s and is about a stranger in town who dies alone, but is given a funeral because he carries a Union Card. “The Load of Wood”, from a story by Frank Hardy, is set during the depression of the 1930’s. “The City”, is a love story set in Sydney in the 1950’s. The three stories are linked by introductory comments from John McCallum, who also narrates them. Cast includes Leonard Teale, Edmund Allison, Jock Levy, Joan Landor, Brian Vicery, Reg Lye.

results.title: MIMA Yearbook. Vol. 2
results.brief_description: Volume two of a three volume set, this video compilation of excerpts of Australian film and video art covers the period from 1980-1983, and is a unique and tantalising entry into non-mainstream history of Australian film and video.

results.title: The Right person for the job
results.brief_description: Excerpts from a seminar held on equal rights legislation held at Trinity College, Melbourne University, are interspersed with dramatisations of problems which women face in the workforce. Shows the role of the conciliation officer and the hearing of a discrimination case by the Equal Opportunity Board
